---
title: Set a main menu
description: How to add a main Menu (hamburger icon) to your media library's header bar.
---

import { Aside } from "@astrojs/starlight/components";


LightNet supports adding a main menu in the header bar, displayed as a hamburger icon in the top right corner.  
The menu can link to internal or external pages.

Here's an example configuration:

```js title="astro.config.mjs" ins={5-22}
export default defineConfig({
  integrations: [
    lightnet({
      // ...
      mainMenu: [
        {
          href: "/",
          label: "ln.home.title",
        },
        {
          href: "/media",
          label: "ln.search.title",
        },
        {
          href: "/about",
          label: "x.navigation.about",
        },
        {
          href: "https://lightnet.community",
          label: "LightNet",
        },
      ],
    }),
  ],
})
```

This example menu configuration links to:
- the home page on `/`
- the search page on `/media`
- the about page on `/about`
- an external website on https://lightnet.community

Notice how the links do not include a locale. The locale is automatically added by LightNet.

#### Menu item properties

- **`href`**: Defines the link destination. It can be internal (e.g., `/media`) or external links (e.g., https://wikipedia.org). 
  External links open in a new browser tab.
  <Aside>
    Do not add locales in front of your internal links (use `/media` and not `/en/media`).
    LightNet automatically adds the locales. You can disable this behavior by setting  
    `requiresLocale: false` on the menu item.
  </Aside> 
- **`label`**: The text displayed on the menu item. Use a [translation key](/build/i18n/fundamentals) for localized or a fixed string for non-localized labels.
